intro: Betonica parvula, commonly known as small betony, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture, while its flowers bloom in clusters. Betonica parvula is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in herbal medicine.
